name: Basics of Food Science
long_desc: Food is essential for life and the maintenance of health. As consumers we know little about its constitution and processing. This course will shed light upon the main nutrients found in food and their properties. We will discuss the importance of different processing techniques and about the ingredients added to food that extend its shelf life, or that improve its mouthfeel, and appearance. Overall, this course aims to make students aware of the intrinsic value of food, and how its manipulation and eventual reconstitution leads to an acceptable final product found in the supermarket.

custom_fields.goals: We expect that at the end of this course studen ts gain an understanding of the chemical and physical properties of macro and micronutrients in food and their importance. This knowledge will enable students to better understand the nutrition labels on food products, asses s the nutritional value of supermarket produce, and will make them aware of the ingredients added to food to increase its appeal, flavor, and shelf life. Some of the ingredients added to food are used in quantities that can b e detrimental to health if the consumer is not aware of this an example be ing salt. Students will develop criteria to identify these and other facts about food.
custom_fields.key_topics: Food and food quality; water; beverages; carbohydrates; lipids; chocolate; amino acids, peptides, and proteins; milk and milk products.

Our goal is to educate students on = the processing, manipulation and value of food. We expect to demystify misconceptions about certain= foods and ingredients and reveal food hidden health hazards (such as high = sugar and salt). We expect that students gain an understanding of food rela= ted facts at the molecular level (for example: what is High Fructose Corn Syrup, a widely spread sweetener; how is obtained; how is different from suc= rose, and how is perceived by the customer). Our aim is that students actively participate in the classes as well as they contribute questions and their own perception and knowledge.
